metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2700 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in libvirt. This security flaw ouccers due to repeatedly querying an SR-IOV PCI device's capabilities that exposes a memory leak caused by a failure to free the virPCIVirtualFunction array within the parent struct's g_autoptr cleanup.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2700` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-clients - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon-config-network - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon-config-nwfilter - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon-driver-lxc - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-iscsi-direct - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon-driver-vbox - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon-driver-xen - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon-system - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon-system-systemd - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-daemon-system-sysv - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-login-shell - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-sanlock - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt-wireshark - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
libvirt0 - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> looks like this was introduced in: c97518d9b833a607f29b9bb02e3fbe74c011c088

criterions.comment: libvirt package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.0-1ubuntu7.5').
